dublin_core.dcvalue: Nuwan Waidyanatha, Senior Research Fellow, LIRNEasia, Email: nuwan@lirneasia.net | Laurent Elder, Program Officer, IDRC, Email: lelder@idrc.ca

RTBP provides the ability to detect and monitor communicable and non-communicable diseases at the village level through mobile phones. Village level nurses use the mHealthSurvey software to transmit symptoms, suspected and diagnosed diseases to a browser-based statistical analysis software that detects adverse events. Health officials are then notified of adverse events through SMS, email and web.
Made available in DSpace on 2020-10-14T10:20:04Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 1 realtime_biosurveillance_program.pdf: 262022 bytes, checksum: b85748c3c0f2165c0952b9f0e24c72e2 (MD5)
data collection and reporting, Infectious Diseases, Non-communicable Diseases, Malaria and other vector-borne diseases
